comments:
Choose an orm.xml attribute mapping and select the blank option in the Map As combo box. This causes an NPE:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.resource.MultiObjectDependencyTranslator.getDOMName(MultiObjectDependencyTranslator.java:57)
at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.createNewNode(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:860)
at org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.internal.emf2xml.EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.primCreateAdapter(EMF2DOMSSEAdapter.java:255)
at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.createAdapter(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:803)
at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.primUpdateDOMMultiFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:341)
at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.primUpdateDOMMultiFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1343)
at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.updateDOMMultiFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1595)

at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.XmlPersistentType.insertAttributeMapping(XmlPersistentType.java:471)
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.XmlPersistentType.changeMapping(XmlPersistentType.java:437)
at org.eclipse.jpt.core.internal.content.orm.XmlPersistentAttribute.setSpecifiedMappingKey(XmlPersistentAttribute.java:277)


The blank option should not exist, there is no default in the orm.xml file.  The user should use the Remove menu option in the structure view

Created an attachment (id=70931)
proposed patch

Low risk patch to remove the blank option from the xml attribute mapping combo box.  Not an ideal fix, but a good one for RC3 so that we make sure not to break anything.

This is a major issue since users will likely end up selecting this "blank" choice  in the combo box, either to try and remove a mapping, or by accidentally selecting the wrong item in the combo.  After having done this, any time you select the owning Entity or any of the attribute mappings in this entity, you will get an error dialog with an NPE that prevents you from mapping anything in that Entity.  It won't be obvious to the user that they need to revert this action to recover.

The fix simply removes the "blank" option from the combo, as it is incorrect that it is there in the first place.  The fix is low-risk, tested, and approved.  Requesting PMC approval.
